abstract.para: The primary platforms for which Swarm is supported are Solaris running on a Sun Sparc, GNU/Linux running on an Intel 386 and up and Windows NT. However, we currently have users running Swarm on platforms such as GNU/Linux on a PowerPC, HP/UX, DEC Alpha and SGI. This page is the clearing house for information on the various platforms.

sect1.title: GNU/Linux
sect1.para: GNU/Linux is a freely available Unix-like operating system that provides the default operating system for Unix applications running on small personal computers, including Macintosh (See the MkLinux note below). It is the easiest operating system with which to run Swarm because the distributions usually provide the latest versions of the Swarm support software pre-installed (which means that one need not install GCC, X, or Tcl/Tk by hand). It is also turning out to be one of the best Unix-like operating systems to use because there are many avenues for help and many users out there who have dealt with esoteric situations and configurations, thereby making it very well supported. Debian and Redhat are two excellent GNU/Linux distributions.

sect2.title: LinuxPPC: this information is currently outdated
sect2.para: Darold Higa of the University of Southern California has provided a step-by-step guide for installing Swarm on the Mac using the LinuxPPC distribution. The notes refer to Swarm 1.4.1. Thanks Darold!

sect1.title: MacOS X
sect1.para: Bill Northcott has ported the CVS development snapshot of Swarm to MacOS X, binaries (and README files) are available at: http://savannah.nongnu.org/files/?group=swarm.

sect1.title: HP/UX
sect1.para: Swarm 2.0 is known to run on HPUX 9, 10, and 11. Java users of Kaffe will need this libltdl patch. Also, to avoid a linker bug, build gcc-2.95 with this compiler patch to gcc/objc/objc-act.c

sect1.title: IRIX
sect1.para:
We have reports from some successful users of Swarm on SGIs in the following configurations:
SGI Origin 200, IRIX 6.4, GCC 2.7.2.2 w/old_ld configured for IRIX 5.3
IRIX 5.3, GCC 2.7.2.1
IRIX 6.4 GCC 2.8
IRIX 6.5 GCC 2.95.1
Note that IRIX users need to install libffi, and configure Swarm with the --with-ffidir option.

sect1.title: Windows 95/98, NT 4.0, and Windows 2000
sect1.para: Kaffe requires a libltldl patch to load Swarm libraries.
